channel.title: Overclocking
channel.description:
My CPU currently idles between 28C and 34C, dual core 1.9ghz. Could I overclock this enough to make a noticeable difference without having to replace the cooling unit?
Also, how do I overclock? (never done anything like this before)

item.title: Overclocking
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

up your fsb in little increments until it feels unstable, when its unstable increase the vcore very slightly rinse and repeat until your cool, stable and happy with your overclock, or when ur pc blows up

Read full topic

item.title: Overclocking
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

eczema3:

What exactly is the FSB and what does it do?

It’s a front side bus which transfers data to cpu. Your total clock speed is calculated by multiplying the FSB speed by the CPU multiplier. eg if your FSB runs at 200Mhz and you have a x12 cpu multiplier the frequency would be 200 x 12 = 2400Mhz = 2.4GHz.
When you overclock you change these values.

Read full topic

item.title: Overclocking
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

What exactly is the FSB and what does it do?

Also: [quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:9, topic:341368”]use nVidia’s overclocking tool, asuming you have an nVidia card.
i do believe it may be possible to do it with other graphics cards.[/quote]
Thank you for this, just increased my GPU by 150mhz and the memory bus by 100mhz and increased the fan speed so it runs faster & cooler now :D, it also has tools for doing my CPU and other parts of my system.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

my CPU is idling at 24C, I have never overclocked either… I didn’t think there was much point.

I am using a Q9400 (or it could be the Q9450) and a Asus P5Q Deluxe motherboard

Read full topic

item.title: Overclocking
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

That temperature is cool, there’s defiantly room to overclock. Ideally you don’t want your cpu to idle over 45C. Whether the overclock would be worth it is a doubt though…
My pentium 4’s and atom idle at around 50C and there’s no damage to them!

If you do want to o’c"
Firstly you should update your BIOS firmware.
Then go into it (pressing f2,f10,f11,del depending on manufacture) and find the advanced/frequency menu and then increase the FSB speed and the cpu multiplier slowly. You should note that if you may need to increase the voltage of the cpu core to ensure stability.
To be honest, I would just google a better guide.

Read full topic
